The above-mentioned verses on experiencing happiness are the foundation of the path to enlightenment and can also nurture supreme, perfect enlightenment.
For this reason, I first described the characteristics of happiness in the sutras.
Good man!
It is like worldly necessities that can serve as causes for happiness, and are therefore called happiness.

Namely, women's bodies, intoxicating alcohol, delicious flavors, water when thirsty, fire when cold, clothing, ornaments, elephants, horses, carriages, male and female servants, gold, silver, lapis lazuli, coral, pearls, granaries, and rice. Such things are needed in the world and can be causes of happiness. This is called happiness.
Good man!
Such things can also give rise to suffering. Because of women, men give rise to suffering, worry, sorrow, and even lose their lives.
Because of alcohol, delicious flavors, and even granaries, they can also cause people to experience great sorrow and distress.
For this reason, everything is suffering and has no characteristics of happiness.
Good man!
